some MIT visual models of statistical representations of human development http://hdr.undp.org/en/humandev/lets-talk-hd/

Direct link to the MIT report, somewhat intimidating title but very readable contents. Includes some early history of visualizing information and their process for developing the HDI tree. http://hdr.undp.org/en/reports/global/hdr2010/papers/HDRP_2010_39.pdf
love it!! http://www.thenounproject.com/

got a saks catalog in the mail yesterday and they used different paper weight and finishes to express different fashion "styles". they used heavyweight high gloss paper for the bright bold graphic fashions, matte lighter-weight paper for the more natural, flowing fashions, and a soft satin paper for the more feminine looks.  interesting idea that we could apply to deliverables?  let me know if anyone is interested in seeing the catalog.

ever find yourself thinking "what are folks doing for video presentations that inspire/motivate folks into action?  I think kickstarter is a killer place to sort of see how people present ideas, we could take alot of cues from these folks https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/danprovost/glif-iphone-4-tripod-mount-and-stand?ref=search
love this stuff http://jtnimoy.net/workviewer.php?q=178
Mint designers launch a new visualization inspiration portal concept http://youtu.be/AiVKfNeRbPQ
very cool design storyboard comics starter kits http://designcomics.org/
http://www.tagxedo.com/
99% is one of my favorite websites for all things pristine and groovy, i love this poster http://the99percent.com/articles/7035/The-2011-Idea-Execution-Audit
zanran is a new search engine for graphs, we could use it to find examples of stuff we want to make or use http://zanran.com/q/
The Number Picture is a pretty cool site that provides templates for data visualization where you can pick a visual you want to make, enter your data and presto http://numberpicture.com/
http://www.facebook.com/socialmemories

for the longest time now i've seriously believed that social networks can offer us a kind of online social persona of people pretty damn well, networks see relationships, usage behavior, likes, interactions, pictures, collecting our interests etc,   this social memories app, while yes its cool for individuals, its basically an auto persona generation tool, imagine using this in a priming activity http://infosthetics.com/archives/2011/05/social_memories_an_infographic_book_of_your_facebook_activity.html#extended
another facebook persona builder http://www.intel.com/museumofme/r/index.htm
this one is for drew, make some plz http://www.pattern-matters.com/
use of mechanical turks + visualization... also explains origin of the "mechanical turk" http://www.ted.com/talks/aaron_koblin.html
http://visual.ly/about self described compilation of the "best visualizations on the web" as well as a touch of social medium to critique and show, and view work.
this is very cool could be useful later on as we roll out more advanced tools ourselves http://imagecharteditor.appspot.com/
